Author: The Matadore
Review: We went there as the sky was getting dark, and it was lightly raining, which in my opinion is the time to be there. I really appreciated this area especially under those circumstances. There were restaurants, beautiful buildings, trees on hills, and the lights along the path were lit, so the experience was quite magical. The shrine with the lanterns lighting everything around was beautiful. It was definitely a highlight for me.

Author: Andre Sianipar
Review:
I love every temple and shrine in Japan, everything like zen, this one is one of the beautiful shrine and if i think again this shrine is not far from Kyoto station, only use one time Bus with number 206 if im not mistaken.
walk in the evening you will see dazzling sunset from the gate of the shrine...
aah memorable place, will back again for sure...

Author: David P
Review: The Yasaka Shrine area had the most beautiful, elaborate, and massive temples and shrines we saw throughout our entire visit to Japan. Some of the structures are simply breathtaking. Beautiful to behold. I highly recommend that you visit here. there are monks that actively pray here, and we heard many of them chanting and praying in the background during our visit.

Author: Big Red Zed
Review: I enjoyed a magic day here in early autumn. The shrine is great to walk around, however I encourage you to take on the small hike to the summit of the nearby hill. The views from the top were magnificent. Also bonus, found a four leaf clover!

Author: Zephyriousity Ph
Review:
It was beautiful even at night. Or during night. This shrine shines so bright, it seem so magical. It is big and you will enjoy roaming around inside.
It was close a night, the souvenir stores to get your charms. However, your prayers can be said quietly. This place should really be on someone's itinerary.

Author: gradhito
Review: A brightly colored shrine right next to the relaxing Maruyama Koen.Only around 10-15 minutes walk also from the famous Kiyomizu-dera. I was there when the Miko were doing some praying/dancing routine inside the shrine, it was very nice to see. It is said to be the main shrine for Gion festival.

Author: Tim
Review: Beautiful Shrine located at the very end of the traditional Gion district. Although not big, the atmosphere and appearance rivals that of the other bigger shrines in Kyoto. I highly recommend a visit at night when there are less people around and the shrine is lit up.

Author: Justin Benko
Review: This shrine is right in the centre of gion district in Kyoto. It‚Äôs quite popular and big, but it doesn‚Äôt have some of the same character as the other smaller shrines. I also felt like the temple staff were a little rude . They seemed almost annoyed that I was buying things from them

Author: Shingo Sae-Lim
Review:
(Trip was made back then on 1 Dec 2019, 2 years before the Covid-19 Pandemic hit)

Yasaka Shrine is one of Kyoto‚Äôs most iconic landmarks, with it‚Äôs beautifully elaborate main gate greeting you upon entering, to it‚Äôs distinctive central stage that looks even more amazing at night with the gentle glow of the lanterns.

Being one of the most famous shrines in Kyoto, they play host to the the Gion Matsuri during the summer festival, which is said to be the most famous festival for the whole country.

Though we weren‚Äôt able to experience it, we were still able to appreciate the temple‚Äôs beauty during our autumn trip to Kansai regions 2 years ago.

It‚Äôs conveniently located needy to Maruyamacho Park, Chionin Temple and Shorenin Temple which can be covered within the same day since they are in the same area and are worth a visit.

Author: Poulami das
Review: A must visit place in Kyoto. The place is very peaceful. The hike to the top is doable. After overcoming the initial rush of crowd, the rest of the trail is mostly devoid of tourist. Must must visit this if you are in Kyoto.

Author: Shu Yee
Review: Nice place to visit. It‚Äôs open even at night. Most of the temple close at 4-5pm. This one is 24/7.

Author: Martin Jarc
Review: Lovely forest temple. The temple is at the end of the bamboo forest so we decided to check it out. It was a really good decision. Moss fairytale with lovely shrines woven into it. It looked amazing and felt really peaceful. Will return to it. I liked this part of Kyoto very much.

Author: randall
Review:
Walked past this shrine on my way to Gion and it was pretty nice. There are many smaller shrines along the side and the whole place is within a park. Saw visitors ringing the bell which is for you to make a wish if I'm not wrong.

The gardens outside the main shrine smell really nice too by the way. Think they planted jasmine or something.

Author: Jason Camorlinga
Review: This small shrine is the perfect gateway to the Gion district. There are sometimes food vendors selling various treats and at night the lanterns make it a great place to take a stroll. There is no admission fee to this area.

Author: Thanh di·ªáp
Review: Yasaka Shrine is a beautiful Shrine, you can visit here day and night, with great view

Author: Harsh Parekh
Review:
Absolutely gorgeous place! Highly recommended visiting and spend a good few hours enjoying the nature.

Should make sure to try out Amazake while you're here.

Author: Wilson Yap
Review:
Beautiful Shinto shrine that is quiet.
Look out for the lanterns where people donated money to the temple in the middle at night.
And best thing is there‚Äôs no fee to roam the premise.

Author: Julian Gorman
Review: Traditional shrine with plenty of great photo spots but mind the crowds. Dress up to make it a little special.

Author: Tom Liu
Review: Free entry and you can ring the bells in the shrine. Do remember to pay respects by bowing though

Author: Doc Rock
Review: This place is beautiful and we went at about 1330 had a nice stroll,prayed at the temples and had a goshuin signed. We left for lunch and came back about 1700 at dusk and it‚Äôs even prettier as the lights come on.

Author: Aulia Andini
Review:
You must visit this shrineüëçüèª

The thing i love the most bout traveling in Japan is most of their tourist-must-visit places = free-entranceüëåüèª

And yeah ofc, the shrine is so beautifulüòç

Author: Anze Hao
Review: Super nice and must visit shrine within walking distance of Gion

Author: ArmRatch
Review: Nice shrine where you can visit at night. I went to make a wish at here when I went to Kyoto.

Author: Ivan Yu
Review: Nice place there. A night festival take place there during new year's eve to Japan New Year.

Author: Krisna Ginanjar
Review: Came here at the first Sunday in January. It was full of people praying and getting fortune. It was a great tourist spots too. A lot of food stalls at the entrance.

Author: Nasti
Review: I love this shrine, no matter how crowded it is. I deffinitely reccomend visiting

Author: GR
Review: Busy street. The night market sells food that is quite pricey. Worth the visit but not the food

Author: Silvia Bongiovanni
Review: I spent the new years eve countdown at Yasaka,  such an amazing experience! Walking around the temple at night is very suggestive and the food stalls are very delicious - takoyaki are a must!

Author: Carlos Gonzalez
Review:
Amazing during the snow.
We caught a big cold snap and it only made the scenery that much more incredible

Author: Ni N.
Review: Beautiful shrine. Many tourist people. Great architecture. There's shop selling souvenirs also.

Author: Elizabeth Barlow
Review: Nice shrine and very close to other sightseeing places in Kyoto. You can walk here from the Pagoda and Kiyomizu

Author: C He
Review: Such an amazing place to visit during new years! I had such a great time in this amazing shrine

Author: Brandon
Review: Pretty nice place. It's on the main strip so it's work a visit and there is some decent street food here.

Author: Dorothy Wong
Review: Super duper busy and police had to do crowd control at midnight hours on New Year's Eve into New Year's Day (Dec 31st 2022-Jan 1st 2023)

Author: Ethan Sheridan
Review: this shrine is absolutely beautiful at night. it's empty and peaceful. It's not large and doesn't take much time so make sure to stop and see the shrine you won't regret it

Author: Jessica Adams
Review: A beautiful Shrine with a stunning atmosphere, particularly at dusk. It's quite small and won't take long to look around, but worth it. Street food markets also added to the atmosphere and experience.

Author: Angsophea Eng
Review: Beautiful shrine with street food at the entrance. There are charms shop inside with many god shrines you can visit and pray to. They mainly take cash so no need to bring credit cards here. Additionally, the nature and tree around this area is exceptional. There are multiple entrances and exit around with one leading to two other parks or shrine nearby! Inside near the street food have kimino rental as well.

Author: Will Dixon
Review: Great stroll round a quite pretty and atmospheric shrine. Worth a quick detour to.

Author: Danny Sung
Review:
Kyoto's Ayaka Shrine is a must-visit for anyone interested in Japanese history and culture. The shrine is peaceful, serene, and surrounded by beautiful natural scenery.

Visiting the shrine is a great way to get away from the busy city and immerse yourself in a traditional Japanese setting. The staff is friendly and welcoming, and they're always happy to answer any questions you may have about the shrine and its history.

Whether you're a history buff or simply looking for a peaceful place to relax and recharge, Ayaka Shrine is an excellent choice. The shrine's beautiful architecture, serene surroundings, and rich history make it a truly special destination.

Author: Brian Lin
Review: We were here early December. Spectacular views everywhere and not too crowded.

Author: Madi
Review: Yasaka Shrine is a must-see in Kyoto. The shopping street leading to it from the train station is also well worth looking through!

Author: Happy happy
Review: It look nice but more or less the same as other temples.

Author: Dan
Review:
This place is absolutely stunning!
I've been during both the day and the night and would highly recommend going late one evening

We walked freely with very few other people around and it was such a nice experience.

Take a tripod so you can nail those night photos. All of the sights are very well lit.

Author: Dan Arreola
Review: Pro tip: go here at 8pm. All the crowds are gone and the place is lit up beautifully. All pictures were taken around 8-8:30pm on a Sunday.

Author: Nathan Dore
Review: A peaceful shrine with beautiful buildings close to Hanamikoji Street. It's beautifully lit up at night, as is the surrounding shrine areas and temples. If you're in the area, I recommend viewing this place as its a good sight to see

Author: I‚Äôm ‚ÄúFull Time Papa‚Äù Stan lee
Review: I think the icon of this temple is their lantern, quite a nice to place to visit while you looking for something different from other temple

Author: Charles
Review: Yasaka shrine is same as Fushimi Inari Shrine of Nara which is Japanese shrine. But it lack of uniqueness which Fushimi Inari Shrine has, there is a long shrine gates set in a row that is good for picture taking. Japanese shrine is different from temple which is just on the doorway outside the shrine makeshift stall can sell food. Temple strictly forbidden. It is good and bad. It can attract crowd but disrespect the god.

Author: Ana I.A.
Review:
We visited this shrine at night and it was absolutely beautiful, even just seeing it all lit up from afar was breathtaking. There seems to be many areas, and some very old buildings as well. You can access the Gion gardens from here, as well as start down the old streets down to Ninenzaka if you enjoy walking through timeless areas.

We do wish we had time to visit it in the daytime too, but we will just have to do that next time, it was definitely worth visiting at night.

You can get super cute little bunny omamori here üê∞ just sayin'.

Author: Riz Moon
Review: First shrine to visit in Kyoto so was quite impressive. Big crowd, groups of young people many of whom are couples, were wearing traditional clothing for picture taking even if it was raining and cold. On a day at the end of January there was no real flowers yet but snow flowers were every direction and as beautiful as Sakura blossom

Author: Dexter
Review: Yasaka Shrine weat gate.  Beautiful as ever! Although we wasnt able to visit inside.  But its one of a must visit in kyoto.

Author: Boris Torentika
Review:
Beautiful orange-themed temple.
Wide area, much to explore.
I went there at night and I personally think the vibe is more sacred.

Author: Fadhil Amadan
Review:
Yasaka Shrine is a beautiful and historic shrine located in the heart of Kyoto. The shrine is known for its stunning architecture, including the iconic vermilion gate and the main hall with its intricate carvings and decorations. Visitors can also enjoy the peaceful atmosphere of the shrine's gardens and surrounding forest.

The shrine is a popular destination for tourists and locals alike, and it's easy to see why. Whether you're interested in history, culture, or just want to take in the beauty of Kyoto, Yasaka Shrine is definitely worth a visit.

Author: Mika Silander
Review: Easy to visit. Small market area inside where you can buy some Japanese street food.

Author: Jean Geisser
Review: Nice Island with great food outlets and shops

Author: Natasha Ramay
Review: It was our first time visiting a Shinto shrine. We went in the night time when there were very few people. It was very peaceful and beautiful. I would suggest to visit in the morning to actually absorb the beauty of this place .

Author: Alexa Rievera
Review: There is very crowded on weekends. Especially now that it's almost time for the cherry blossoms to bloom.

Author: Ivana Josifov
Review: Beautifull park, very nice place to visit

Author: Freja Tousgaard Andersen
Review: Very central. Very popular tourist destination. A must see, but not our favorite experience in Kyoto.

Author: Jan-Angel Echano
Review:
A bit touristy for me. There are similar temples with a much peaceful vibes in Kyoto. But still a beautiful temple.

Vlog will always be available at my youtube (@soraltrading) and on my other social medias.

Author: Carl Cheong
Review: Entrance is free, as a start point of Gion, why would anyone skip it?

Author: Lukas Bauer
Review: Beautiful shrine in spring, due to its big size, it's not too crowded

Author: Linus
Review: Great place to buy charms and also, cherry blossoms viewing. It is on the way to Kiyomizudera.

Author: Nitika
Review: It was a pretty crowded day (thanks to Sakura season) but the visit was worth it. The shrine complex is huge and even had many local food stalls that almost felt like a festival.

Author: Kristyna Tynkova
Review: Visited late at night and it was definitely worth it!

Author: H L
Review: A Must go spot in Kyoto. ÂÜàÂ±±ÂÖ¨Âúí next to it is full of cherry trees - a prime spot during cherry blossom season. Then a leisure stroll to Ê∏ÖÊ∞¥ÂØ∫ passing 1/2/3Âπ¥ÂùÇ and the neinei road„ÄÇWe went there 3 times during our visit - always full of tourists.  But it‚Äôs a must go. So plan to go at diff times on diff days to get diff feel.  Next time I‚Äôd leverage my jet-lag from the US n go at the crack of dawn.  Ê∏ÖÊ∞¥ÂØ∫ opens at 6 anyway ü§£

Author: Paula Joubert
Review: Lovely park, well cared for. The lights at night are very special. Lots 9f street food vendors.

Author: S T
Review: Early morning less crowds. Sakura is pleasantly beautiful to enjoy.

Author: Alessandro
Review: Very beautiful shrine. Visit it during sunset to see all the lights light up.

Author: Marius Nicula
Review: Forst day in Kyoto, we were really tired, so only managed to get a short walk to here from our accomodation. It's really something else when you see it in person, and we'll definitely visit it often while we are here.

Author: Razvan
Review: Wonderful place to visit and then take a stroll in the park

Author: Xuan Fu
Review: Went during the day. Peaceful to tour around.

Author: Fran
Review: Beautiful shrine in the middle of Gion district,  there is a food market on the back I am not sure if the market is every night there.

Author: Athleticgirl 86
Review: Beautiful well-kept temple complex. Not all places of worship were open at the time of our visit (mid-April). One can buy talismans on site accordingly. If you have a corresponding booklet for temple / shrine, you can also pick up the stamp. Mostly, the booklets are also available on site, or you can get the stamp on a separate paper.

Author: Elena Plescan - Elena the Expat
Review: After seeing so many shrines, they all look same) What I think it‚Äôs special about this one are the lanterns and the fact that it‚Äôs surrounded by a park.

Author: Angie Lee
Review:
2 Apr 2023:
We visited this place at night and it's pretty and well-illuminated. There's quite a lot of people at night, to our surprise. You can only imagine how packed is it here during the day. Worth a visit if you're around the area.

Author: Cher Lee Kiat
Review: Scenic shrine with a mix of torii and praying towers. Plenty of kimono clad ladies walking within. It‚Äôs also used for wedding ceremonies.

Author: Sanka Illangakoon
Review: Yasaka Shrine, located in the Gion district of Kyoto, is a beautiful and historic Shinto shrine that is well worth a visit. It is located in close proximity to Maruyama Park. The shrine is famous for its beautiful vermilion gate, or torii, which marks the entrance to the shrine. Once inside, visitors can explore the beautiful grounds and various buildings, including the main hall and worship hall. The shrine is particularly popular during the Gion Festival, one of Japan's most famous festivals, which takes place in July. Overall, Yasaka Shrine is a must-visit destination for anyone interested in Japanese culture, history, and architecture, and provides facilties for prayers, Omikuji and buying lucky charms.

Author: Mohammed AlZahrani
Review: I enjoyed visiting this shrine at night on my first day arriving to Kyoto. Yasaka Shrine is one of the most famous and popular shrines in Kyoto, Japan. It is known for its stunning architecture, vibrant festivals, and historical significance. The shrine has been an important religious site for over 1350 years, and it is dedicated to the prosperity and good fortune.

Author: Mariee M.
Review: A traditional shrine with a quiet atmosphere located on Gion Street. I recommend taking a walk in the evening where you can see beautiful Japan style lights.

Author: SL Wong
Review: This temple is located right at the end of Gion Street, where the famous main Tsujiri green tea shop is located. There is a matsuri festival going on when I was there in April, and there's this scary ghost house where you pay 600yen for people to come and scare you. Hahah.

Author: Shreyamsa Manjunath
Review: Impressive during the day, but the number of people around may dampen the atmosphere. Magnificent during the night, with very few people visiting. The lights and lantern give a magical touch. However, all parts of the shrine cannot be explored at night. Worth visiting both times!

Author: Austin Wu
Review: That was very lucky to see the temple is in the snowing. It‚Äôs cold and wet but the temple vibe is amazing. The historical building is so beautiful and well preserved. The temple garden is close to the fashion district. It‚Äôs nice to pray for fortune here.

Author: Amanda Rutherfoord
Review: Beautiful shrine and park! Would recommend renting a kimono and walking around the area! If you can go during the week, that is probably best.

Author: Vgs photos
Review: Beautiful shrine in the heart of Kyoto. Such beautiful architecture. Larger than expected with a beautiful park nearby.

Author: Dan Arif
Review: This place and Chion-in are awesome! So many beautiful photo ops there. My wife and I dressed up in the kimonos and had a photo shoot at both places. Also free! Much better than Kiyo-mizu which is meant to be no.1. It was so packed there.

Author: Itzik levy (Izikl)
Review:
very nice temple.
looks grate at night.
even at midnight people are coming to pray.

Author: Mia Chen
Review: It's a great place to take photos if you are wearing Kimono, not crowded as the other places around

Author: For Peen
Review: Packed with tourists with good reasons. The entire site is sprawling with many mini shrines around so explore (respectfully) and walk around.

Author: Johnny Lam
Review: An area with multiple shrines in the Gion area. There's also some food stalls here too!

Author: Nigel Lim
Review:
One of my favourite spots in Kyoto, just a short walk from Kiyomizudera and the Gion shopping district.

Nice place to go as the sun goes down, with all the lanterns lit.

There are also much less people here compared to Kiyomizudera, so you'd get the peaceful atmosphere you'd expect from a shrine.

Author: Gorav Gupta
Review: This is a beautiful shrine, great for pictures! I went here 4 or 5 times during my few days in Kyoto. It has a lot of tourists so keep that in mind, but I would highly recommend checking it out. Also, they have a beautiful park connected to it that is worth walking around if you have time!

Author: Yujin Chang
Review: I don‚Äôt know how such a beautiful place could be so terrifying at night!! During day or night, Jinja shrine is still utterly gorgeous and both times provide wildly different experiences. While clogged with visitors near the beginning, it quickly empties out the further in you travel which is always nice. The multiple shrines on the way up are beautiful, with plenty of vending machines to use if you get worn out!

Author: Ruben Royackers
Review: Wonderful shrine with a beautiful park attached to it. Great to eat your picnic here.

Author: theaniks
Review: Nice quick stop. Shrine looks very nice and it wasn't too busy either.

Author: Alyson Singer
Review: Go early to beat the crowds and don't overlook the lesser known ones. Admire the Japanese visitors wearing their hired kimonos

Author: Laura
Review: A beautiful shrine that is unique! Highly suggest you visit at night as it's well lit and seeing the lanterns lit is an amazing sight.

Author: Peter Sohl
Review: Yasaka is definitely best viewed at night. The lanterns are beautiful and the crowds are not nearly as bad as during the day. It's a quick, free shrine close to tons of restaurants and shopping, so there's not much of a reason not to stroll through.

Author: Shahab ‚ÄúCro‚Äù Khan
Review: Just happened upon this beautiful shrine at twilight. The ambiance and lights are enchanting. The bonus is the little park being the temple. Quiet and peaceful. Definitely worth a stroll.

Author: Naimisha Sanjay
Review:
Yasaka-jinja Shrine is an absolute must-visit shrine in Kyoto, particularly in the evening when it is beautifully illuminated. The captivating lighting enhances the charm and elegance of the shrine, creating a truly enchanting atmosphere.

The architecture of Yasaka-jinja Shrine is simply awe-inspiring. The intricate details and exquisite craftsmanship of the structures will leave you in awe. It's a testament to the rich cultural heritage of Japan and the craftsmanship of its artisans.

Visiting this shrine offers a peaceful and serene experience. You can spend hours here, immersing yourself in the tranquility and finding solace amidst the bustling city. It's a place where you can truly relax and let the worries of the world melt away.

Whether you're seeking a spiritual experience, a cultural exploration, or simply a serene environment to unwind, Yasaka-jinja Shrine is the perfect destination. The serene ambiance, coupled with the architectural splendor, creates a harmonious setting that will leave a lasting impression.

Make sure to include a visit to Yasaka-jinja Shrine in your Kyoto itinerary, especially during the evening. The illuminated beauty of the shrine is a sight to behold, and the tranquility it offers is a welcome respite from the busyness of everyday life.

Author: NoahJon Marshall
Review: totally fine and relaxing during the day but the move here seems to go at night (it never closes and it‚Äôs free). the wires get in the way of photos during day. go to the right (east) and walk to the pond. there‚Äôs a tiny land bridge between two ponds that‚Äôs cool. the pond had a soft shell turtle in it, a real treat. after, head north about 10 mins for the other gardens/temple.
